posts.title: Rumble Fish
posts.excerpt: Harvard Film Archive writes:One of the Coppola’s most overtly stylized works, Rumble Fish uses its breathtaking black and white, Koyanisqaatsi-inspired time-lapse photography and propulsive original score by The Police’s Stewart Copland to evoke a dream world of alienated youth. A beautiful postmodern art film, Rumble Fish is wonderfully uncertain of its time and place, stranding …

posts._title: Nelson Pereira dos Santos – Raízes do Brasil: Uma Cinebiografia de Sérgio Buarque de Holanda AKA The Roots of Brazil (2003)
posts.title: Raízes do Brasil: Uma Cinebiografia de Sérgio Buarque de Holanda
posts.excerpt: Cinebiography of celebrated historian Sérgio Buarque de Hollanda, who wrote the seminal “Raízes do Brasil” in 1935, with interviews with his large family (including his widow and his seven children, among them famous composer/singer/writer Chico Buarque and singer Miúcha) and scholar friend Antonio Candido.

posts._title: Andrey Smirnov – Belorusskiy vokzal AKA Byelorussia Station (1971)
posts.title: Belorusskiy vokzal
posts.excerpt: Quote:A sympathetic, emotionally persuasive drama describing the friendship of four World War II veterans, their sudden reunion after 25 years and the subsequent effect of this occasion upon their thoughts and evaluations of the past and present. In a way, The Byelorussian Station is reminiscent of the poignant, realistic look at the returned soldier remembered …

posts.title: Shablool
posts.excerpt: A collaboration from popular Israeli composers and rockers Arik Einstein and Shalom Hanoch, this film is a campy, offbeat romp along the lines of the Beatles’ films. Part musical, part mockumentary, the film centers on the making of a great rock album titled “Shablool.” Einstein and Hanoch star in multiple roles in their cinematic creation, …

posts._title: Atif Yilmaz – Gece, Melek ve Bizim Çocuklar aka The Night, Angel and Our Children (1994)
posts.title: Gece, Melek ve Bizim Çocuklar
posts.excerpt: A story set in the back alleys and nightclubs of Beyoğlu among drag queens and prostitutes, pimps and hopeless lovers… It shows all the dark corners of Beyoglu, Istanbul. Prostitutes, transexuals and their pimps are the protagonists of this movie, which is quite unlikely for a movie made in 1994. More strange thing is that …
posts.titleEnglish: The Night, Angel and Our Children

posts.title: The Three Stooges
posts.excerpt: A biography of the Three Stooges, in which their careers and rise to fame is shown throughout the eyes of their leader, Moe Howard.

posts._title: Bethel Buckalew – The Pig Keeper’s Daughter (1972)
posts.title: The Pig Keeper’s Daughter
posts.excerpt: Quote:Moonbeam Swyner, the pig keeper’s curvaceous daughter, is patiently waiting for her Prince Charming. But, in the meantime, the uninhibited redhead is bent on putting her charms to good use, driving the local boys crazy. However, everything is about to change, when Moonbeam has a chance encounter with a travelling perfume and lingerie salesman, who …

posts._title: Robert Hossein – Le vampire de Düsseldorf AKA The Vampire of Dusseldorf (1965)
posts.title: Le vampire de Düsseldorf
posts.excerpt: In the 1930s, chaos and misery reign over Düsseldorf as the Nazis begin their campaign of terror. But the city is afflicted by another menace, a serial killer who writes a letter to the police every time he murders a young woman. Who would suspect Peter Kuerten, a man who is so mild and unassuming? …

posts.title: Monkey Business
posts.excerpt: Quote:On board a ship to America, four stowaways get involuntarily pressed into service as toughs for a pair of feuding gangsters while trying desperately to evade the ship’s crew. Prior to this, the film has no real plot, just the brothers causing unending uproar. Except in the credits and in the screenplay, the Brothers’ characters …

posts._title: Robert Florey & Joseph Santley – The Cocoanuts (1929)
posts.title: The Cocoanuts
posts.excerpt: Mr. Hammer runs a bankrupt Florida hotel. He’ll try anything to make money, even make love to rich Mrs. Potter. But his main scheme, selling real estate, is in danger of sabotage from zanies Chico and Harpo, who also reduce the schemes of a pair of jewel thieves to chaos. A subplot involves the star-crossed …
